intro: Uvariastrum hexaloboides, commonly known as the six-lobed uvaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashews and mangoes. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical, waxy leaves with a leathery texture. It produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or red when mature. Uvariastrum hexaloboides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
